meanings.definition: To sell (goods) in large quantities or at a rapid rate.
meanings.sent1: The store was superselling its new products to many customers.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys superselling her handmade crafts at the local market.
meanings.sent3: The magician was superselling his disappearing act to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The auctioneer was superselling the rare painting to eager bidders.
meanings.sent5: The enthusiastic salesman was superselling the benefits of the new vacuum cleaner.

meanings.definition: The act of selling goods in large quantities or at a rapid rate.
meanings.sent1: The superselling of electronics during the holiday season was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was attributed to their superselling of popular items.
meanings.sent3: The superselling of ice cream on a cold winter day seemed unusual.
meanings.sent4: The superselling of tickets for the concert broke records.
meanings.sent5: The superselling of books at the book fair delighted the organizers.
